data.name: Jason
data.text:
Re Ê¥û‰∏ª: "dig up the grave" is a specific expressions in Chinese forums (of course tieba). 
I found the exact word with keywords "old post 
forum" on Google: Necropost
"A Necropost is a post on an 'old', abandoned thread that has been considered 'dead' for a while... that no longer serves any purpose but is bumped back up to the top of the forums by someone posting it."
See https://en.scratch-wiki.info/wiki/Necropost

data.name: Jason
data.text: btw, it really confuses me that someone in a forum not familiar with 'hot'... I **do** think 'hot' is widely used to represent posts/comments becoming popular fast and are new, both in English and Chinese forums

data.name: Ê¥û‰∏ª
data.text: Re Jason: yeah I knew what hot means, but I'm just being cautious, cuz that person may be talking about some memes, like 'hot food(that old man saying nice)'or hot‚ôÇ. thank you for teaching me a new word! but necro- just sounds so mysterious or religious hhhh. I'm thinking of Necronomicon.

data.name: Ê¥û‰∏ª
data.text: Re Jason: bzw, I'm fond of memes so I would try to make clear of every occasion where there might be a meme, in case I missed a joke or misunderstood one.

data.name: Jason
data.text:
Re Margaret: a hole full of ass slangs might be funny (although bit rude), a hole full of badass is also ok, but if the meaning of "ass hole" is such an ass like you or something worse, it's a disaster.
Better simply kick your ass, 1/10

data.name: Jason
data.text: Re Ê¥û‰∏ª: necro- is a prefix from **Greeks** meaning death, and other words with this prefix, like necrophobia, also suggest that it's horrible or mysterious, hmmmm. I also found someone using "zombie threads/posts" instead, but not so common as necroposts.

data.name: Jason
data.text: Re dz: Well, you think necro- sounds so "mysterious" because of Necronomicon. I wonder if some beginner in learning Chinese see the Chinese meme "ÊåñÂùü", how will he/she feel about it XD?

post.text:
Hey dude, I suddenly came up with something new.
What about a hole where we can only speak in English?
If you like it, maybe next time we can also have a French hole, German hole, Italian hole...
Say whatever you want please!
Just for practice and for fun :)
